title: Check & Calibrate Anemometer (Gill WindSonic)
content:
Overview:
Verify the WindSonic anemometer is reading accurately and apply calibration if required.

Prerequisites:
- Calm conditions or wind generator
- Multimeter, laptop with station access, alignment compass
- Access to data logger (CR1000X) program

Steps:
1) Isolate power to the sensor at the junction box.
2) Inspect and clean transducer faces; remove debris or ice.
3) Check mounting: boom level, arrow aligned to true north (apply site declination).
4) Restore power; confirm 12V present and serial output in logger port status.
5) Baseline test: in no-wind, verify speed ≈ 0 m/s and direction stable.
6) Two-point check: expose to ~2 m/s and ~10 m/s airflow; log values for 60 s each.
7) If offset > ±0.2 m/s or direction > ±3°, update coefficients in the logger program.
8) Save and deploy program; annotate change log.

Verification:
- Speed within ±0.2 m/s of reference and direction within ±3° for both points.

Safety:
- Use fall protection on towers. De-energize lines before handling wiring.
notes: If erratic after rain, leave powered for 10 mins—moisture can recover out.

title: Two-Point Barometer Calibration
content:
Overview:
Calibrate the barometric pressure sensor at low and high setpoints.

Prerequisites:
- Reference barometer (traceable)
- Stable ambient temperature (25±2 °C)
- Access to logger config

Steps:
1) Allow sensor to thermally stabilize for 30 minutes.
2) Apply low setpoint (≈950 hPa) using the calibration chamber; record reading.
3) Apply high setpoint (≈1030 hPa); record reading.
4) Compute slope/offset; enter offsets in the logger or sensor EEPROM.
5) Save config and tag with calibration date.

Verification:
- Error ≤ ±0.3 hPa over range.

Safety:
- Handle pressure fittings carefully to avoid leaks.
notes: Recalibrate after any firmware change affecting sensor linearization.

title: Clean & Calibrate Tipping-Bucket Rain Gauge
content:
Overview:
Perform monthly cleaning and flow calibration on the tipping-bucket gauge.

Prerequisites:
- Deionized water, graduated cylinder (200 mL), level, soft brush
- Access to logger pulse count

Steps:
1) Remove funnel and screen; brush out debris and insect nests.
2) Check the base is level using bubble level; adjust feet.
3) Drip exactly 200 mL over 20 minutes; observe tip counts.
4) Adjust reed switch and bucket stop to achieve correct mm/tip.
5) Refit funnel; verify no leaks.

Verification:
- Tip count within ±1 tip of expected for 200 mL.

Safety:
- Beware of slick surfaces after cleaning.
notes: Record final mm/tip and ambient temperature during calibration.

title: Validate Pyranometer (CMP11) Irradiance
content:
Overview:
Verify irradiance readings and cleanliness of the pyranometer dome.

Prerequisites:
- Lint-free wipes, pure ethanol, soft brush
- Access to reference station or model clear-sky curve

Steps:
1) Inspect cable and bubble level; re-level as needed.
2) Dry brush dust; clean dome with ethanol and lint-free wipes.
3) Compare 10-minute averaged W/m² to reference or clear-sky model.
4) If deviation >5% under stable sky, check shading and wiring polarity.
5) Document cleanliness class and any offsets applied.

Verification:
- Deviation ≤5% under clear conditions.

Safety:
- Do not use abrasive pads; they scratch the dome.

title: Replace Thermo‑Hygrometer Sensor (SHT35)
content:
Overview:
Replace a drifting SHT35 temperature/humidity probe and apply offsets.

Prerequisites:
- Replacement SHT35, small screwdriver, antistatic precautions
- Access to shelter (radiation shield)

Steps:
1) Power down the sensor channel at the logger.
2) Remove shield cap; avoid touching the white filter element.
3) Swap the SHT35 module; secure connector.
4) Power up and allow 2-hour burn-in at ambient.
5) Compare against reference RH/T; apply offset if RH drift >2% or T >0.3°C.
6) Log serial number and offsets.

Verification:
- RH within ±2%, T within ±0.3°C vs reference.

Safety:
- Handle sensor by edges; oils skew humidity response.
notes: Seal shield properly to avoid aspirator leaks.

title: Upgrade Data Logger Firmware (CR1000X)
content:
Overview:
Safely upgrade CR1000X firmware and verify station program integrity.

Prerequisites:
- Latest CR1000X firmware file, USB/ethernet access
- Backup of logger program and data

Steps:
1) Export current program and a data snapshot.
2) Upload and apply the firmware via LoggerNet/DeviceConfig.
3) Reboot logger; confirm COM ports and sensor addresses.
4) Re-deploy the station program; monitor compile output.
5) Validate critical sensors (wind, temp/RH, rain) produce values.

Verification:
- No compile errors; sensor scans nominal for 10 minutes.

Rollback:
- Reflash prior firmware and restore backed-up program if validation fails.
notes: Confirm time sync after upgrade; NTP may reset.

title: Restore LTE Connectivity (Cradlepoint)
content:
Overview:
Diagnose and restore WAN connectivity on the station LTE modem.

Prerequisites:
- Access to modem UI, SIM info, carrier support contact
- Knowledge of APN and static IP requirements

Steps:
1) Check signal metrics (RSSI/RSRP/RSRQ/SINR); record values.
2) Verify SIM status and data plan; re-seat SIM if not detected.
3) Reboot modem; confirm IP assignment and APN profile.
4) Test DNS and outbound reachability (ping traceroute).
5) If RSRP < -110 dBm, re-aim antenna or move to backup carrier profile.
6) If static IP site, validate NAT/port-forward rules.

Verification:
- Station heartbeats visible; latency within expected range.

Safety:
- Observe ESD when handling SIM/antenna connectors.
notes: Escalate ISP ticket if PDP context fails repeatedly.

title: Replace 12V AGM Battery in Power System
content:
Overview:
Replace an aging AGM battery and validate charging performance.

Prerequisites:
- Correct AGM replacement, torque wrench, PPE (eye protection)
- Multimeter and load tester

Steps:
1) Isolate solar charger; remove negative terminal first.
2) Remove old battery; inspect for swelling/leaks.
3) Install new battery; torque terminals to spec.
4) Restore charger; verify float/absorb voltages.
5) Run 10-minute load test; log voltage sag and recovery.

Verification:
- Resting voltage ≥12.7V; under load stays within spec.

Safety:
- Avoid shorting terminals; wear eye protection.
notes: Record install date for lifecycle tracking (3 years typical).

title: Install Lightning Sensor (Vaisala)
content:
Overview:
Install and integrate the lightning detection sensor with the station logger.

Prerequisites:
- Mounting hardware, grounding kit, shielded cable
- Logger input available and driver ready

Steps:
1) Mount sensor per vendor standoff and orientation guidelines.
2) Bond to single-point ground; verify <5Ω to ground.
3) Route shielded cable; avoid parallel runs with power lines.
4) Wire to logger; configure pulse/count input channel.
5) Generate test pulses or await storm to validate counts.

Verification:
- Pulse counts visible and debounced in logger.

Safety:
- Work only in safe weather; follow grounding best practices.
notes: Keep away from tall metal structures to reduce false triggers.

title: Deploy Weather Application Release
content:
Overview:
Deploy a new application version with zero-downtime and post-deploy checks.

Prerequisites:
- Release artifact, DB migration plan, healthcheck URL
- Rollback artifact available

Steps:
1) Announce change window; freeze config toggles.
2) Run DB migrations in maintenance mode (if any).
3) Deploy app to blue/green or rolling set; monitor health endpoint.
4) Verify station ingest, API latencies, and dashboards.
5) Gradually shift traffic; watch error rates and queues.
6) Tag release and update runbook notes.

Verification:
- No elevated error rates; ingestion pipeline stable for 30 minutes.

Rollback:
- Revert to prior artifact; restore DB backup if needed (if destructive migration).

Safety:
- Keep on-call informed; have comms open with field techs.
notes: Attach release notes and ticket IDs to the deploy record.
